name: ngspice

conflicts.name: %gcc@:4.9.9
conflicts.description: ngspice: Failure to compile recent release with old gcc due to hicum2
ngspice: This release does not compile

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: debug
variants.description: Enable debugging features: auto is yes for build=lib, no for build=bin

description:
ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic
circuits.

dependencies.name: acfl
dependencies.description:
Arm Compiler combines the optimized tools and libraries from Arm with a
modern LLVM-based compiler framework.

dependencies.name: adms
dependencies.description:
ADMS is a code generator that converts electrical compact device models
specified in high-level description language into ready-to-compile c
code for the API of spice simulators.

dependencies.name: amdfftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW (AMD Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. AMD Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for AMD CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install amdfftw precision=float LICENSING INFORMATION: By
downloading, installing and using this software, you agree to the terms
and conditions of the AMD AOCL-FFTW license agreement. You may obtain a
copy of this license agreement from
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-
libraries-4-1-eula.html
https://www.amd.com/en/developer/aocl/fftw/eula/fftw-libraries-eula.html

dependencies.name: armpl-gcc
dependencies.description:
Arm Performance Libraries provides optimized standard core math
libraries for high-performance computing applications on Arm processors.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: cray-fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). This package is a wrapper
for Cray's version of FFTW. To install this package, list it as an
external package in packages.yaml, and make sure to load the correct
cray-fftw module. In some cases you need to load cray-mpich before cray-
fftw.

dependencies.name: fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). This package is a wrapper
for Cray's version of FFTW. To install this package, list it as an
external package in packages.yaml, and make sure to load the correct
cray-fftw module. In some cases you need to load cray-mpich before cray-
fftw.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: fontconfig
dependencies.description: Fontconfig is a library for configuring/customizing font access

dependencies.name: freetype
dependencies.description:
FreeType is a freely available software library to render fonts. It is
written in C, designed to be small, efficient, highly customizable, and
portable while capable of producing high-quality output (glyph images)
of most vector and bitmap font formats.

dependencies.name: fujitsu-fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW (Fujitsu Optimized version) is a comprehensive collection of fast C
routines for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT) and various
special cases thereof. It is an open-source implementation of the Fast
Fourier transform algorithm. It can compute transforms of real and
complex-values arrays of arbitrary size and dimension. Fujitsu Optimized
FFTW is the optimized FFTW implementation targeted for A64FX CPUs. For
single precision build, please use precision value as float. Example :
spack install fujitsufftw precision=float

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: intel-mkl
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: intel-oneapi-mkl
dependencies.description:
Intel oneAPI Math Kernel Library (Intel oneMKL; formerly Intel Math
Kernel Library or Intel MKL), is a library of optimized math routines
for science, engineering, and financial applications. Core math
functions include BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, fast Fourier
transforms, and vector math. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and
using this software, you agree to the terms and conditions of the
software license agreements at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: intel-parallel-studio
dependencies.description:
This is an earlier version of Intel parallel software development tools
and has now been replaced by the Intel oneAPI Toolkits. LICENSE
INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software, you agree to the
terms and conditions of the software license agreements at
https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: libx11
dependencies.description: libX11 - Core X11 protocol client library.

dependencies.name: libxaw
dependencies.description:
Xaw is the X Athena Widget Set. Xaw is a widget set based on the X
Toolkit Intrinsics (Xt) Library.

dependencies.name: libxext
dependencies.description: libXext - library for common extensions to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: libxft
dependencies.description:
X FreeType library. Xft version 2.1 was the first stand alone release of
Xft, a library that connects X applications with the FreeType font
rasterization library. Xft uses fontconfig to locate fonts so it has no
configuration files.

dependencies.name: libxmu
dependencies.description:
This library contains miscellaneous utilities and is not part of the
Xlib standard. It contains routines which only use public interfaces so
that it may be layered on top of any proprietary implementation of Xlib
or Xt.

dependencies.name: libxrender
dependencies.description: libXrender - library for the Render Extension to the X11 protocol.

dependencies.name: readline
dependencies.description:
The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by
applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed
in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library
includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered
command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform
csh-like history expansion on previous commands.

dependent_to.name: qucs
dependent_to.description:
QUCS - Quite Universal Circuit Simulator Qucs is an integrated circuit
simulator which means you are able to setup a circuit with a graphical
user interface (GUI) and simulate the large-signal, small-signal and
noise behaviour of the circuit. After that simulation has finished you
can view the simulation results on a presentation page or window.

dependent_to.name: kicad
dependent_to.description:
KiCad is an open source software suite for Electronic Design Automation
(EDA). The programs handle Schematic Capture, and PCB Layout with Gerber
output.
